title: Helen Flanagan reveals OCD battle and brands fiancé Scott Sinclair 'gormless' during labour
text:

Helen Flanagan has revealed she has struggled with social anxiety and battled OCD which worsened after the birth of her daughters.

The 29-year-old actress would compulsively gulp when she was out in public as part of the disorder.

Helen explained that having her daughter changed her life so much that when it came to going back out and being in social situations, she found it incredibly hard, despite being an outgoing performer before.

Speaking on Giovanna Fletcher's Happy Mum Happy Baby podcast, Helen said: "I kind of lost my confidence and even though I love [Matilda] to bits, I found it quite hard in social situations.

(Image: Barcroft Media via Getty Images)

"No one would think that because you know Helen, sure, you’re an actress you can go talk to anyone".

Helen added that she had always had mental health issues, but that they worsened after Matilda was born.

She continued: "It was 100% was in overdrive after Matilda because you have this baby and you love them more than anything in the world, and you start thinking crazy things like ‘god, what happens if I die, this baby needs me.’"

Helen's fiancé is footballer Scott Sinclair, 30, who she has been with for 10 years.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

They have 16-month-old Delilah and four-year-old Matilda together.

Helen opened up about his "gormless" reaction when she went into labour for the first time.

She said: "I was 11 days overdue having contractions, and he was like 'do you not think it is all in your head?'"

She revealed that she called him "all the names under the sun" and even had to put her own pregnancy bag in the car because "Scott was doing his hair".

When they got the hospital, Helen ended up making Scott leave the room, wishing she had her mum with her.

(Image: Instagram)

She said: "I was looking at him thinking: 'Why isn’t my mum here?'

"The second time wasn’t much better", she added.

"He looked a bit gormless, to be fair. They don’t get it."

Helen also suffered from hyperemesis when she was pregnant with Delilah, which causes severe nausea and vomiting.

She said this made her feel like terrible parent as she was unable to care for Matilda.

"I remember feeling like a rubbish Mum because I couldn’t change a nappy", she said.

"You feel like a rubbish girlfriend or wife because you literally cannot do anything."

But one thing helen did enjoy about being pregnant was her changing body.

"I was just so excited to be quite honest with you and I know this might sound a bit cringe, but I would always stick my tummy out a little bit more so it looked like I had a big tummy", she confessed.

"I just loved it. I loved having this big bump."
description: Helen Flanagan has opened up about her mental health battle and why fiance Scott was not helpful during her child birth
